info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:33AM EDT until April 6 at 11:54PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Fall Creek at Millersville.
.Recent multiple rounds of heavy rainfall have lead to minor river flooding on Fall Creek in Millersville. Fall Creek will rise to near Moderate flood levels by early this evening before receding through minor flood levels Sunday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Fall Creek at Millersville.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Fall Creek. Local roads are flooded. Building northeast of gaging site can be flooded by a few feet of water if flood protection fails.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EDT Saturday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.9 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall late this afternoon. It will rise to 12.0 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 845 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING
